analytic.title: TO THE MOST REVE∣REND FATHER IN GOD, RICHARD, by Gods prouidence Byshoppe of London. &c.
analytic.author: R., I.

monogr.title: An epitaph, on the death of the late most reuerend Father in God, Iohn: by his prouidence the Arch-Byshop of Canterburie his Grace. &c : Made to runne vpon the letters of his names and tytles. &c. His Grace deceased at Lambeth in the yeere of his age 72. Februarie 29. 1603. And his funerall rightes were kept at Croyden the 27. of March following. 1604

div.head: TO THE MOST REVEREND FATHER IN GOD, RICHARD, by Gods prouidence Byshoppe of London. &c.

To the right Worshipfull M. George Whitegift, and to all the kindred and friends of that name: I. R. wisheth all health and comfort ouer their great heauinesse, for the death of the late Arch-Byshoppe of Canterburie his Grace. &c.
div.p: NOt to be tedious to your good Lordship, and Worships (considering your waightie affaires at this time) In few wordes (presuming vpon your courtecies) I present you with this poore Pamphlet or Epitaph, which I haue made on the death of the late most reuerend the Lord of Canterburie his Grace: (to whom I was much bounden and beholding, as many of his Gentlemen and others do well know.) And now being driuen with the streame of my loue, duetie, and good-will to his grace, as also to your good L. and Worships: I can not but doe some thing (with others) as the last part of seruice that I can doe for his Grace in this life: I most humbly beseech you all therefore, to accept well of the same, and to protect it vnder the winges of your fauours; and then I shall not need to care for Zoylus, Momas, and the rest of that viperous brood. &c.

closer.signed: Your Lordship, and Worships most humbly to be commaunded. I. R.
